promises.text: A healthier alternative to conventional sports drinks, featuring a balanced amount of electrolytes and significantly reduced sugar and calorie content.

reality.evidence: An analysis of the nutritional information of HOLY Hydration, LMNT, and Nuun reveals distinct compositional differences. HOLY contains only 0.1 g of sugar per 100 ml and approximately 4 kcal, which is significantly lower than conventional sports drinks like Gatorade and Powerade, which typically contain around 6–8 g of sugar and 25–30 kcal per 100 ml. HOLY also includes key electrolytes such as potassium (60 mg/100 ml) and magnesium (11.3 mg/100 ml), though in lower concentrations than LMNT, which delivers 1000 mg sodium, 200 mg potassium, and 60 mg magnesium per serving. Nuun tablets fall between these extremes, offering a balanced profile with 300 mg sodium and modest carbohydrate content. Compared to LMNT, HOLY’s sodium level is substantially lower (<0.1 g salt per 100 ml, ~40 mg sodium), making it less suitable for high-intensity endurance use, but well-suited for casual or everyday hydration.
reality.verdict: HOLY Hydration is objectively healthier than traditional sports drinks but does not offer superior performance metrics compared to modern hydration products designed for endurance or clinical use.
